snippet: Interest in health care sharing ministries has grown among people who want to follow their religious beliefs, save money and not be forced to buy insurance.
abstract: Membership in health care sharing ministries, which require members to help cover one another's medical costs, has more than doubled over past six years, to 535,000 from 200,000; nonprofit ministries cannot guarantee medical bills will be paid because they are not insurance companies, but members are urged to trust that God will provide; membership continues to grow through word of mouth.
lead_paragraph: Interest in health care sharing ministries has grown among people who want to follow their religious beliefs, save money and not be forced to buy insurance.

headline.main: Christians Flock to Groups That Help Members Pay Medical Bills
